prompts.prompt: I want to create a custom skill for my team to help with financial report generation. Can you walk me through how to get started?
I need to build something that helps Claude work with our company's specific API documentation and workflows, but I'm not sure what structure to use.
I have a bunch of Python scripts I keep rewriting for data processing tasks. How can I package these so Claude can reuse them efficiently?
Can you help me create a specialized tool that combines our brand guidelines, template files, and design workflows into something Claude can use for marketing materials?
I wrote up some instructions for Claude to handle our customer support process, but it's getting really long and Claude seems to struggle with it. How can I make it more effective?
I need to turn my domain expertise in legal contract analysis into something Claude can use. What's the best way to structure all this knowledge?
My skill works great for simple cases but fails on complex scenarios. The instructions are too vague in some places and too rigid in others. How do I fix this?
I want to create something that helps Claude work with our database schemas, but the documentation is huge. What's the smartest way to organize this?
I built a custom tool for Claude but I'm not sure if I should put certain information in the main instructions or separate reference files. How do I decide?
I have a working prototype that helps Claude with our procurement workflows, but I need to package it properly and test it with my team. What's the right process?
